om.tnavigator.db
Class OmQueries

java.lang.Object
  om.tnavigator.db.OmQueries
Direct Known Subclasses:
PostgreSQL, SQLServer
public abstract class OmQueries
extends java.lang.Object

Used to obtain a version of the SQL queries used in Om for a given database. This base class provides (fairly) standard SQL versions. Needs to be overridden for each supported database.

insertResult

public void insertResult(DatabaseAccess.Transaction dat,
                         int qi,
                         java.lang.String questionLine,
                         java.lang.String answerLine,
                         java.lang.String actionSummary,
                         int attempts)
                  throws java.sql.SQLException
Store the results of a question attempt.

Parameters:
dat - the transaction within which the query should be executed.
qi - question instance id.
questionLine - Text summary of question.
answerLine - Text summary of user's answer.
actionSummary - Text summary of all the user's actions.
attempts - number of attempts at the question. 1 = right first time, 2 = right second time, etc.; 0 = pass, -1 = wrong.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException

insertTestQuestion

public void insertTestQuestion(DatabaseAccess.Transaction dat,
                               int ti,
                               int number,
                               java.lang.String questionID,
                               int requiredVersion,
                               java.lang.String sectionName)
                        throws java.sql.SQLException
Add a new row to the testquestions table.

Parameters:
dat - the transaction within which the query should be executed.
ti - test instance id.
number - sequence number of the question within the test.
questionID - question id.
requiredVersion - required major version of the question, from the test definition file.
sectionName - Which section of the test the question belongs to.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException

insertTest

public void insertTest(DatabaseAccess.Transaction dat,
                       java.lang.String oucu,
                       java.lang.String testID,
                       long rseed,
                       int attempt,
                       boolean admin,
                       java.lang.String pi,
                       int fixedVariant,
                       java.lang.String navigatorVersion)
                throws java.sql.SQLException
Create a new test attempt within the database.

Parameters:
dat - the transaction within which the query should be executed.
oucu - the user's username.
testID - the deploy file ID.
rseed - the random seed the user was assigned.
attempt - attempt number for this user of this quiz, starting at 1.
admin - 1 if this is an admin attempt, otherwise 0.
pi - the PI of the user.
fixedVariant - for testing, fixes the variant of each question.
navigatorVersion - the version of the test navigator that started this attempt.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException

currentDateFunction

protected java.lang.String currentDateFunction()

unicode

protected java.lang.String unicode(java.lang.String quotedString)
Parameters:
quotedString - String surrounded in quotes and quoted as appropriate for normal SQL.
Returns:
Same string also quoted with any necessary changes bearing in mind that this string may contain non-ASCII characters (for sane databases, this is the same as the input, but not all databases are sane)

getInsertedSequenceID

public abstract int getInsertedSequenceID(DatabaseAccess.Transaction dat,
                                          java.lang.String table,
                                          java.lang.String column)
                                   throws java.sql.SQLException
Immediately after an insert into a table that contains an auto-generated sequence column, this method returns the value of the ID that was just added.

Parameters:
dat - Transaction (insert must be previous command)
table - Table name, without the prefix.
column - Column name
Returns:
ID value
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - If database throws a wobbly

getPrefix

public java.lang.String getPrefix()
Returns:
the prefix

checkTables

public void checkTables(DatabaseAccess.Transaction dat)
                 throws java.sql.SQLException,
                        java.io.IOException
Checks that database tables are present. If not, initialises tables using createdb.sql from the same package as the database class.

Parameters:
dat - the transaction within which the query should be executed.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - If there is an error in setting up tables
java.io.IOException

upgradeDatabaseTo131

protected void upgradeDatabaseTo131(DatabaseAccess.Transaction dat)
                             throws java.sql.SQLException
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException
